title: More readable (same style)
prompt:
You will receive a Note (may include typed text, handwriting, diagrams, screenshots).

Goal:
Create ONE cleaned-up image version of the note that keeps the original vibe and structure, but becomes significantly more readable and organized.

Hard rules:
- Use only information present in the Note. Do not invent facts, definitions, or examples.
- Preserve the original meaning and priority of topics.
- If handwriting is unclear, mark it as [unclear] briefly or omit it if it would mislead.
- Keep all text legible on a phone screen.

Readability upgrades:
- Fix alignment, spacing, margins, and grouping.
- Convert messy paragraphs into headings + short bullet points.
- Normalize typography: consistent font sizes, consistent capitalization, consistent bullet style.
- Remove clutter: duplicates, scribbles, repeated arrows, overlapping text.

Layout:
- Portrait layout.
- Title at the top (derive from the note if possible).
- 3 to 7 sections as clean cards or blocks.
- Add a small “Key Takeaways” box at the bottom with 3 to 5 bullets.

Style:
- Keep the same overall look as the original note, but polished.
- Minimal color, only subtle highlights if they improve scanning.
- Clean white or very light background.

Output:
- Return exactly 1 final image.
- No extra pages, no variants, no mockups.

title: Colorful + poppy (same style)
prompt:
You will receive a Note (may include typed text, handwriting, diagrams, screenshots).

Goal:
Create ONE vibrant, modern, colorful study poster image that keeps the content and structure of the Note, but makes it feel fun, energetic, and easy to scan.

Hard rules:
- Use only information present in the Note. Do not invent facts.
- Keep text readable on a phone screen: strong contrast, no tiny text.
- If handwriting is unclear, use the simplest conservative interpretation or omit it.

Color and design:
- Use 4 to 6 consistent accent colors (vibrant but not neon).
- Color-code sections and highlights.
- Use friendly icons, callouts, and simple shapes to guide the eye.
- Background must remain light and clean, not noisy.

Layout:
- Portrait layout.
- Title at the top.
- 3 to 7 colored section cards with headings + bullets.
- Add a “Key Takeaways” box at the bottom with 3 to 5 bullets.
- Use clear hierarchy: big headings, medium subheadings, compact bullets.

Style:
- Bright, modern educational infographic.
- Rounded corners, soft shadows, consistent spacing.

Output:
- Return exactly 1 final image.
- No extra pages, no variants, no mockups.

title: More readable + diagrams
prompt:
You will receive a Note (may include typed text, handwriting, diagrams, screenshots).

Goal:
Create ONE clean, highly readable study poster image that preserves the original content, and adds or redraws diagrams only when they clarify the material.

Hard rules:
- Use only information present in the Note. Do not invent facts.
- If handwriting is unclear, keep it minimal, mark as [unclear], or omit.
- All text and diagram labels must be readable on a phone screen.

Diagram rules:
- Only include diagrams that explain relationships, such as flowcharts, cycles, hierarchies, timelines, comparisons, or cause effect.
- If the Note already has diagrams, redraw them cleanly with consistent shapes and labels.
- Keep diagrams simple: few nodes, clear arrows, minimal decoration.
- Every diagram must have a short title or label.

Layout:
- Portrait layout.
- Title at the top.
- 3 to 6 content sections.
- Include 1 to 3 small diagrams placed near the sections they explain.
- Add a “Key Takeaways” box at the bottom with 3 to 5 bullets.

Style:
- Clean and minimal.
- Subtle accent colors for headings and diagram elements.
- Clear spacing and alignment.

Output:
- Return exactly 1 final image.
- No extra pages, no variants, no mockups.

title: Colorful + poppy + diagrams
prompt:
You will receive a Note (may include typed text, handwriting, diagrams, screenshots).

Goal:
Create ONE vibrant, colorful study poster image that preserves the Note’s content and meaning, and uses clear diagrams to make concepts easy to understand.

Hard rules:
- Use only information present in the Note. Do not invent facts.
- Maintain excellent readability: strong contrast, consistent font sizes, no tiny text.
- If handwriting is unclear, use the simplest conservative interpretation or omit.

Color and design:
- Use 4 to 6 consistent accent colors.
- Color-code sections and key terms.
- Use friendly icons and callouts sparingly to guide attention.
- Background stays light and clean.

Diagram rules:
- Add or redraw 1 to 3 diagrams when they clarify relationships.
- Diagrams should be simple and clean: consistent shapes, readable labels, clear arrows.
- Place diagrams directly near the section they support.

Layout:
- Portrait layout.
- Title at the top.
- 3 to 7 colorful section cards.
- Add a “Key Takeaways” box at the bottom with 3 to 5 bullets.

Style:
- Modern educational infographic.
- Rounded corners, soft shadows, balanced spacing.

Output:
- Return exactly 1 final image.
- No extra pages, no variants, no mockups.

title: Cheat sheet (no diagrams, max text)
prompt:
You will receive a Note (may include typed text, handwriting, diagrams, screenshots).

Goal:
Create ONE dense, structured, highly readable cheat sheet image that fits as much important content as possible, without diagrams.

Hard rules:
- Use only information present in the Note. Do not invent facts.
- Do not include diagrams, drawings, or decorative visuals.
- Maximize information density while keeping text readable on a phone screen.
- If handwriting is unclear, omit it rather than guessing.

Cheat sheet formatting:
- Use compact headings, subheadings, and short bullet points.
- Prefer concise phrasing and compression over long sentences.
- Convert lists into tight bullet clusters.
- Use compact tables when it saves space (only if the Note already implies a table-like structure).
- Use subtle separators to create clear sections.

Layout:
- Portrait layout.
- Title at the top.
- 5 to 12 compact sections (smaller sections are fine).
- Add a “Most Tested” or “Key Takeaways” box at the bottom with 5 to 8 bullets.

Style:
- Minimal, clean, high contrast.
- Very limited color, only for headings or highlights.

Output:
- Return exactly 1 final image.
- No extra pages, no variants, no mockups.
